meanings.definition: A painful, involuntary contraction of a muscle or muscles.
meanings.sent1: She winced in pain as the cramps in her leg intensified.
meanings.sent2: After running for a long time, he got cramps in his stomach.
meanings.sent3: The cramps in her foot made her dance like a flamingo.
meanings.sent4: The cramps in his back were like tiny wrestlers battling inside him.
meanings.sent5: The cramps felt like a thousand tiny knots tying up her muscles.

meanings.definition: Metal clamps with serrated jaws used to hold or compress parts together.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic used cramps to secure the metal sheets in place.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter needed cramps to keep the wood pieces steady.
meanings.sent3: The cramps on the workbench looked like metal alligators.
meanings.sent4: The cramps clamped down on the pipes tightly, preventing any leaks.
meanings.sent5: The cramps were like metal hands gripping the materials firmly.

meanings.definition: A temporary restriction or limitation on activity or progress.
meanings.sent1: The cramps in the schedule delayed the project completion.
meanings.sent2: Her cramps in creativity hindered her from finishing the painting.
meanings.sent3: The cramps in his plans made him rethink his strategy.
meanings.sent4: The cramps in communication caused misunderstandings among the team.
meanings.sent5: The cramps acted like roadblocks, slowing down their progress.
